text:
Surf Ave., north side, east of West 8th Street, to Ocean Parkway, showing at the left the Prospect house, later known as Doyle's Hotel, which was erected in 1875 and known then as Cable's Hotel. Next is the station of the Prospect Park and Coney Island R.R. - the building bears the inscription "Vienna" on its side-; and beyond the station is the Vanderveer Hotel erected
in 1875. (building with turret).
April 16, 1898.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Surf Ave., north side, between West 12th and West 8th Streets. A view of L. A. Thompson's Scenic Railway, still known as such in (1936).
About 1903.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1)

2939-2957 West 8th Street, east side, near Surf ave., showing the Police Station and Magistrates Court for this area. Beyond is the West 8th Street elevated station of the Brighton Beach Line of the B.M.T.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)

The same, a rear view.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1)

2939-2957 West 8th Street, east side, near Surf ave., showing the Police Station and Magistrates Court for this area. Beyond is the West 8th Street elevated station of the Brighton Beach Line of the B.M.T.

(2)

The same, a rear view.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1) West 8th Street, east side, north of Surf Ave., showing the B.M.T. line overhead. Beyond it is the old police station for this area. October 1928. Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, a closer view showing more of the B.M.T. line overhead. January 1924. Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, a view further north showing, partially visible, the firehouse of Engine Co. No. 245, beyond it is the old engine house, headquarters for the exempt firemen. Note the figure in front of it 1-story up. December 1923. Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, another view of no. 3 showing only the old engine house. June 1925. Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1) Surf ave., at the N.W. corner of West 8th Street, showing the former Vanderveer house; which was erected by Mrs. William Vanderveer (Lucy Devlin) in 1875. Later it was known as the Sagamore Hotel.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, showing the "Boardwalk" in the background.

January 1929.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, a partial view, looking south from the elevated station of the B.M.T. lines, showing on the south side of Surf Ave; the entrance to "Dreamland Circus", "War Exhibit", "Scooter", and etc.

January 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, showing also a more extensive view of Surf Ave.

January 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1)
Surf Ave., (general view), north side, east of West 8th Street, showing a rear view of Surf Ave., (at the right). The motor speedway is in the foreground, beyond is the "Coney Island Stadium", and next are the car-barns of the Brooklyn Manhattan Transit Co.

January 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)
The same, a later date. In the background may be seen Seaside Park.

April 2, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1)

April 2, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1) Surf Ave., south side, east of West 8th Street, showing Dreamland Park. July 1924. Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) A view of the West 8th Street side, southward to the "Boardwalk". April 2, 1924. Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, slightly eastward. April 2, 1924. Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, a more limited view. April 2, 1924. Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1)
Surf Ave., south side, east from West 8th Street, showing in the background, the fortress like structure housing the "Palace of Wonders", at the S.W. corner of West 6th Street.

January 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)
The same, further eastward.

July 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3)
The same, at a later date.

About August 9, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
West 8th Street, north from the Coney Island (Reigelmann) Boardwalk, to Surf Ave., as seen across the Dreamland parking grounds. On the west side of the street, is the "Modern Atlantic", specializing in hot salt water baths. Also shown is the "Cyclone" a roller coaster.

August 8, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing also the Luna Park "Towers" in the background.

August 8, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

August 9, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, further eastward, showing also the Eden Musee (wax figures) and the Skooter

July 1, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.
